page.title: 14HOME LIFE:DAD'S BOYHOOD
page.content: Westlands Farm School used to be a farm called Balls Farm, with hay in fields up to chest height! Gallowstree Lane was a narrow, rough track from Thistleberry to Keele Road. Where the swings are now used to be pig styes. Close to that was Hampton's Farm, which is now a scrap yard and what is Thistleberry House today was a Work House now the home for the elderly. (Workhouse : Home for the elderly and poor) Balls Farm delivered milk by horse and cart from their dairy herd to houses where they ladled the milk in your jug. In those days, there was no Paris Avenue shops nor Paris Avenue just fields. The main games were marbles and football which was played in the street. Younger children played tag and Rally ho.
